loans.name: Kagera Group

texts.en:
Tabu, who is in her late 30s, is single with two children. One of them goes to school and the other one is small. She has had a motorcycle business and business selling "bites," or snacks, for four years now. She works from 6 am to 8 pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit. 

This will be her seventh loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to buy a TV set, a DVD deck, fabrics, and motorcycle spares and started selling "bites" such as cakes, mandazi (fried bread), vitumbua (rice patties w/ cardamom, yeast, and coconut), and chapati (unleavened flatbread). She has paid all her loans successfully. Her dream is to one day be able to finish building her house.

Tabu will share this loan with her loan group "Kagera," which has 12 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy another motorcycle and to make more "bites" to sell.

loans.name: Voie Du Salut 1 Group

texts.en:
Lydia, age 42, is married with 5 children, ages 2 to 25 years old. She has 4 children currently attending school. She cares for her father as well. Lydia is representing the Voie du Salut 1 group. She sells used clothing at a stand in a local market. She has been selling used clothing for 18 years! She will use the loan to buy a large bale of used clothing. In Congo, suppliers sell used clothing in large bales. The vendors buy these bales to separate and sell the pieces individually. Her business strategy is to ask her customers what they want or are currently needing and to try to find those items. 
Lydia has received 3 previous loans from Kiva's partner, HOPE Congo. She has a good repayment record. In the future she would like to start another business selling fish.

loans.use: to pay for bales of used clothing.

loans.name: Soum

texts.en: Soum is 34 years old and the mother of two school-aged children. For the last seven years, she has earned a living by running a rice farm. She works hard every day just to meet her family's needs. To earn additional income, she devotes her remaining time to working as a farm laborer on a rubber tree plantation. She currently lives with her family in a house in the Baray district of Kompong Tom province. Soum is requesting a loan for KHR 1,500,000 to buy construction supplies to fix her house. She hopes that she gets this loan, because it will help her family live more comfortably. She thanks Kiva lenders in advance for their support.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies to repair her house.

loans.name: Van

texts.en:
Van, aged 67, is a humble farmer residing in Baray district, Kompong Tom province. She and her husband work in the same type of business cultivating rice as their main source of income. She owns around three hectares of farmland, from which she is able to generate a good yield and income for household expenses. She has been involved in this for ages. Van was blessed with four children, all of whom are already married and have independent lives.

At this time, Van is asking for a loan of USD 800 to purchase a for her family to use. She states that this motorcycle will help her family with transportation. She hopes that Kiva lenders will continue assisting her family so that she can further improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle for her family to use.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy DVDs and CDs and  a CD and DVD player for a movie shop and services business.

loans.name: Bobo

texts.en: Bobo is a man who likes to work very hard. He is very kind, cute, and gentle. For more than 20 years he has been busy in the agriculture business. He grows potatoes, wheat, and another vegetable. He sells his harvest at the local market. His goods have many customers because they are high quality. Bobo's sons help him with his business. His wife died some years ago and that’s why he is the sole provider in the family. He wants to develop his business but his income isn't enough. He is asking for a loan to buy mineral fertilizers for land where he works. He awaits your help and support. Your kindness will make him happy.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en: This is Mohammad, a 25-year-old Lebanese man. He’s single and waiting for the perfect time to get married and start a family. He has only one sibling who works. They both live with their parents at their house, which is located in a very beautiful place. His father is the one who takes on the family's responsibilities. In order to help him, Mohammad works really hard and non-stop. He started his own business in 2008. His job consists of installing sound systems for cars, houses, etc. As he seeks to gain additional income, Mohammad has requested a youth loan from Kiva partner, Ameen s.a.l., to purchase more sound system equipment. Because of this, his business will expand quickly, and therefore, his revenue will increase. Mohammad is really happy with his job, and he looks forward to developing it the best that he can.

loans.use: To purchase more sound system equipment

loans.name: Sut's Group

texts.en: Sut and her family live in a wooden house located in a rural area of Siem Reap province. Sut is 60 years old and married with ten children, one of whom works at the rice field. Sut has been farming rice to support her family for around ten years. She also raises pigs to make additional income. Sut and the other two members in her current group have received and completely paid their previous two loans from VisionFund and they all are now with VisionFund for their third loans. As a leader, Sut used her portion to buy feeds for her pigs. She spent the rest of it on farmland preparation. Sut hopes that this third loan will enable her raise healthy pigs and raise a good yield of crops so that she can sell them for a higher price.

loans.use: to spend on farmland preparation and to buy pig feed.

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Kror Lanh district

loans.name: Voie Du Salut 2 Group

texts.en:
Alain, age 41, is a single father of a 10-year-old child. He also provides for his father. Alain is representing the Voie du Salut 2 group. He operates a grocery stand where he sells many food and household products, including flour, sugar, soap, and milk. Alain will use the loan to buy various food and household items to sell in his shop. His business strategy is to buy his products in bulk which lowers the cost per item. He is able to do this because of the microloan he will receive. 
Alain has received 3 previous loans from Kiva's partner, HOPE Congo. He has a good repayment record. As his business continues to grow, he would like to become a supplier one day.

loans.use: to pay for various food and household items.

loans.name: Imad

texts.en: Imad is a 38 year old Lebanese man. He’s married to Jihane, a sweet woman who he wishes to live the rest of his live with. They have two small children who are still attending school. Imad looks for funds for covering his family expenses, especially his children's study fees. Because of that, he’s working really hard, with the cooperation of his wife, to be able to reach his goals. He started his own business as a private teacher in 1999 with the help of his wife. They receive their students at home to deliver their lessons in a good way. In order to bring added income to the family, Imad works at a local company as well. Today, he’s requesting to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to prepare a special room for teaching. Imad is sure that this will allow him to develop his way of teaching, and thus his communication with the students. Joining a school is one of his greatest dreams, where he could improve his skills and therefore his way of living.

loans.use: to prepare a special room for teaching

loans.name: Soda's Group

texts.en:
Soda is 50 years old and lives in a rural part of the Mongkul Borey district of Cambodia's Banteay Meanchey province. She has three children, including a son who is still dependent on her. For the last five years, Soda has earned 25,000 KHR a day by raising pigs. Her main challenge is a lack of capital to run her business. 

Soda is a member of a four-person loan group and has taken out and repaid four previous loans from VisionFund. These loans have allowed her to refill a ditch in front of her house. Now she and other two members of her group are applying for a new loan for 500,000 KHR each, and the fourth member is requesting 600,000 KHR. As the group leader, Soda plans to use her portion of the loan to buy additional piglets. She hopes to earn enough money to build a decent home for her family

loans.use: to buy more piglets to raise.

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Erdenebaatar

texts.en:
Erdenebaatar, 37, owns a dump truck which carries coal and other heavy things. He uses it for his business of freight transportation around the city and rural areas. He lives with his wife and his daughter in a common apartment in Darkhan, the second-largest city in Mongolia. He previously worked as a fireman in the emergency bureau for many years, but he decided to start his business due to the low salary. His wife is unemployed and she stays at home. His business has been a main income source of his family for years. Sometimes he has no jobs for many days; this is very bad for his business and family, so he wants to run a taxi when his work stops. He plans to buy a car which runs on natural gas. He totally cares about environmental issues, especially air pollution. Now he needs MNT 1,950,000 to cover the remaining cost of purchasing his car. 
Although Mongolia has the lowest population density in the world, it is one of the most polluted countries in the world. This is due to the long and cold winters where temperatures frequently go below -40C (-40F) even in the cities. Also, in winter, many parts of the country are extremely cold and are known to have snowstorms.  Both homes and nomadic tents burn a lot of fuel and emit huge amounts of pollution every night from families just trying to stay warm. Also, the extremely toxic smoke from the cars is one of main reasons Mongolia has hard air pollution. In response to this, Credit Mongol offers Green Loans to their clients to make home improvements that reduce heat loss, improve heating systems, and allows them to buy cars that run on natural gas. We believe that together we can decrease pollution and the harmful effects it has on the environment and Mongolians' health. The loan he is taking will be used to cover the cost of purchasing a natural gas-engine car.

loans.use: to cover the cost of purchasing a natural gas-engine car.

loans.name: Batsuren

texts.en:
Batsuren is 39 years old and he lives with his wife and 2 daughters in a rental apartment in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He runs a small construction company and has been working since 2009. He hires a few builders and pays their benefits from his profits as he can. His company has done many external and internal building jobs since it was established 3 years ago. 
His renting apartment is bad, small, and uncomfortable, so he has decided to build his family a house in the ger district (a ger is a Mongolian traditional nomadic yurt) in the city area. It will have a foam insulation wall. He thinks this will reduce the heat loss and emissions and won’t use much coal fuel.  Although Mongolia has the lowest population density in the world, it is one of the most polluted countries in the world.  This is due to the long and cold winters where temperatures frequently go below -40C (-40F) even in the cities.  Also, in winter, many parts of the country are extremely cold and are known to have snowstorms.  Both homes and nomadic tents burn a lot of fuel and emit huge amounts of pollution every night from families just trying to stay warm. Also, the extremely toxic smoke from cars is one of the main causes of Mongolian hard air pollution. In response to this, Credit Mongol offers Green Loans to their clients to make home improvements that reduce heat loss, improve heating systems, and enables them to buy cars which run on natural gas. We believe that together we can decrease pollution and the harmful effects it has on the environment and Mongolians' health. The loan Batsuren is taking will used to buy wall insulation materials such as the foam boards, rock wool, and bricks.

loans.use: to buy wall insulation materials such as foam boards, rock wool, and bricks.

loans.name: Katerina

texts.ru:
Катерина уже не первый раз пользуется кредитными услугами КИВА. В последний раз она использовала кредит для того, чтобы обновить свой ассортимент товара. 
В этот раз Катерина планирует вложить кредит в размере 9 000 гривен в закупку ассортимента летней одежды: 50 пар шортов, 70 футболок.
texts.en: This is not Katerina's first time using Kiva's lending services.  The last time, she used a loan to update her merchandise selection.  This time, Katerina plans to invest the loan in the amount of 9,000 hryvnia into a purchase of a summer merchandise selection: 50 pairs of shorts and 70 t-shirts.

loans.use: to purchase 50 pairs of shorts and 70 t-shirts

loans.name: Oksana

texts.ru:
Оксана постоянно развивает свой бизнес. За последние 8 лет она приобрела киоск в собственность, тем самым избавившись от необходимости платить аренду за него. 
В этот раз Оксана хочет использовать кредит от КИВА в размере 9 000 гривен для того, чтобы расширить ассортимент конфет, печенья, шоколада, а с его увеличением увеличить и свой доход. Имея более высокий доход, Оксана сможет лучше обустроить свое жилье и улучшить свой образ жизни
texts.en: Oksana constantly develops her business.  Over the last eight years, she purchased a kiosk to own; thus, getting rid of the necessity to pay lease for it.  This time, Oksana wants to use the Kiva loan in the amount of 9,000 hryvnia to expand her selection of candy, cookies and chocolate, and to increase her income as a result.  Having a higher income would allow Oksana to improve her living conditions and improve her way of life.

loans.use: to purchase an additional inventory of cookies, candy and chocolate

loans.name: Un

texts.en:
Un, age 35, is featured at her house located in Baray district of Kompong Tom province. She is married with two school-aged children. Her main business is crop husbandry, which allows her to buy food and support her children’s education. She grows rice, potatoes, and beans for sale. However, her husband is the main income provider, working as a construction foreman. 

Un would like to renovate her present house and make it more comfortable, but due to insufficient capital she is looking for a loan in the sum of HKR 2,000,000 to purchase timbers and floorboards for construction. She is very thankful for constant help from Kiva lenders. For her business goal, Un plans to expand her farming business and increase more output through her effort and patience.

loans.use: to purchase timbers and floorboards for the construction.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy cattle for his cattle business

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es:
Antonia, esta casada y tiene un hijo pequeño, vive en tres habitaciones en anticretico  con paredes de ladrillo y el piso de tierra, ubicada en la zona Ballivián de la ciudad de El Alto.
Antonia  estudió solamente hasta terminar la primaria y actualmente percibe ingresos ya que se dedica a la confección de ropa de cholita y realiza contratos para los grupos y comparsas de bailarines, trabajado por más de doce horas al día ya que debe cubrir los gastos de alimentación y pago de servicios básicos de su familia; es por eso que solicita el crédito  para comprar más tela e hilos y terminar su contrato ya que sus clientes le pagan cuando entrega todo el pedido.
El sueño de Antonia es tener su casa propia y tener su taller para mejorar sus ingresos y su calidad de vida.
Es la primera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y KIVA.
texts.en:
Antonia is married and has a little son.  She lives in three rooms in “anticretico” [a tenant pays a fixed sum upon renting a house instead of  monthly rent, which is considered a loan to the property owner and is returned in full when the rental period is over].  The rooms have brick walls and dirt floors, and they are located in the Balivián zone in the city of El Alto.

Antonia only completed elementary school.  She now gets income from making traditional clothing.  She has contracts from musical groups and dance troupes.  She works for over 12 hours a day because she needs to cover the food expenses and pay for her family’s basic services.

That is why she is requesting the loan to buy more fabric and thread.  She will finish her contract because her customers pay her when she delivers all of the order.

Antonia’s dream is to have her own house and to have a shop in order to improve her income and her quality of life.

This is the first time she has requested a loan with IMPRO and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy more fabric and thread to finish an order for traditional clothing.

loans.name: Suleyman

texts.ru:
Suleyman 39 let. On jenat i imeyet 4 detey. Yego mnogodetnaya semya i Suleyman jivut v Baku regione, on yavlyayetsya IDP personom pereselenec iz Kalbajdar regiona kotoriy yavlyayetsya okkupirovannimi territoriyami Karabakha. 
Suleyman uje 4 qoda kak zanimayetsya transpartirovkoy ludey a takje gruzov. Kak vi videte na fotografii na mashine imeyutsya osobiye jelezniye presposobleniya dlya perevozki tajolix veshey. Seychas on nujdayetsya v 1000 AZN chtobi pochinit svoyu mashinu kotoraya isportilas.
texts.en: Suleyman is 39 years old.  He is married and has four children.  His large family and he live in the Baku region.  He is an IDP, who had to relocate from the Kalbajdar region, which is now an occupied territory of Karabakh.  Suleyman has been involved in transporting people and loads for four years.  As you can see on the photograph, his car has a special metal equipment for transporting heavy things.  Currently, he needs 1000 AZN to repair his car, which broke down.

loans.use: to repair his car

loans.name: Grupo Nagarote Group

texts.es: El g.s. Nagarote esta, conformado por dos integrantes  Laura, Dominga las cuales tienen por actividad ecomonica la venta de meracaderia en general , ella se apoyan mutuamente en sus negocio para salir adelante dia a dia, el, en la actualidad han mejorado su negocios gracia al apoyo que leon 2000  y el programa kiva le han brindado para ofrecer mejor sevicio a sus clientes con las demanda de sus productos como:  pantalones de hombre de vestir, Jeans, camisas, camisetas, blusas, faldas, vestidos, ropa interior, toallas, entre otros.
texts.en: The solidarity group Nagarote comprises two members, Laura and Dominga, whose commercial activity is selling merchandise in general. They support each other in their business in order to get ahead day by day. Currently they have improved their businesses thanks to the support offered by Leon 2000 and the Kiva program so that they could offer their customers better service and meet the demand for their products, such as men's dress pants, jeans, shirts, t-shirts, blouses, skirts, dresses, underwear, towels, and other items.

loans.use: to purchase men's dress pants, jeans, shirts, t-shirts, blouses, skirts, dresses, underwear, towels, and other items.

loans.name: Hebert

texts.es:
Hebert tiene 47 años, tiene una hija llamada Marcelina, con ella viven en la casa que cuidan desde hace 2 años en la localidad de El Tambo.  

Su principal actividad económica es el trasporte. Es ingeniero ambiental de profesión, cada año realiza proyectos de desarrollo, su trabajo es temporal, lo que dure el proyecto. Pero hace algunos años recibió el auto de su amigo, quien se lo dejó para que pueda trabajarlo y sacarle provecho. Por ello, desde las primeras horas del día, hasta el anochecer, sale a las calles de la ciudad para realizar el servicio de taxi. Le va muy bien, pues recibe ganancias todos los días, y en épocas de festividad, obtiene mayor ingreso, ya que existe poca movilidad y él como buen trabajador, aprovecha esas oportunidades. Ahora desea reparar su auto, para trabajar con tranquilidad y de esa manera poder ahorrar.

Este es su segundo crédito con MFP y agradece el apoyo financiero que recibe, pues podrá concretar los objetivos de su negocio. Además promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas, ya que aprende mucho con los integrantes de su grupo.
Hebert invertirá el dinero en la compra de llantas y el pago del mantenimiento de su auto.
texts.en:
Hebert is 47 years old and has a daughter named Marcelina. They both live in the house they have been taking care of for two years in the town of El Tambo.  

His main business is transportation. He is an environmental engineer by profession, and every year he carries out development projects, but his work is temporary, however long the project lasts. A few years ago, he got his friend's car, who loaned it to him so that he could work with it and make a profit out of it. That is why, from the break of day until sundown, he goes out to the city streets to provide taxi services. It is going very well, because he earns an income every day, and during the holiday season he obtains higher profits because there is little mobility and, as a good worker, he knows how to make the most of those opportunities. Now he wants to repair his car, so that he can go to work with peace of mind and so that he can save.

This is his second loan with MFP and he is grateful for the financial support he receives, because he will be able to achieve his business goals. He also promises to pay his installments on time, and says he learns a lot from his fellow group members.

Hebert will invest the money in the purchase of tires and payment for maintenance on his car.

loans.use: to purchase tires and maintain his vehicle.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy thread for a blanket making and selling business.

loans.name: Isidora

texts.es:
Isidora, esta casada y tiene dos hijos pequeños, viven en casa propia, las  paredes son  de adobe y el piso de tierra, la misma se encuentra ubicada en la  Comunidad Achica Baja de la Provincia Ingavi de la ciudad de La Paz.
Actualmente percibe ingresos ya que se dedica  a la producción y venta de queso,con la leche que obtiene de sus vacas lecheras; también se dedica a la agricultura,produciendo vegetales y otros poruductos.  Es por eso que solícita crédito ya que desea comprarse una segadora para   la agricultura para facilitar sus tareas cotidianas y  pagar los gastos de alimentación y servicios básicos de su familia, ya que trabaja por más de doce horas y con lo poco que gana no le alcanza para comprarse una segadora ya que le será de mucha ayuda en su trabajo.
El sueño de Isidora es mejorar sus ingresos y construir su casa ya que desea dar más comodidad a su familia.
Es la primera vez que trabaja junto a IMPRO y KIVA.
texts.en:
Isidora is married and has two little children.  They live in their own house, which has adobe walls and dirt floors.  The house is located in the Achica Bajas community in the Ingavi province in the city of La Paz.

She currently gets income from producing and selling cheese with the milk she gets from her dairy cows.  She also grows vegetables and other products.  That is why she is requesting a loan.  She wishes to buy a reaper that will facilitate her daily farming work, which will help pay the food expenses and the basic services for her family.  She works for over 12 hours a day, and with the little that she earns she does not have enough to buy a reaper.  It would help her a lot in her work.

Isadora’s dream is to improve her income and to build a house because she wants to make her family more comfortable.

This is the first time she has worked with IMPRO and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy a reaper to facilitate her work planting and producing vegetables.

loans.name: Betty

texts.es:
Betty es soltera y no tiene hijos, vive en la casa de sus padres ocupando una habitación con paredes de adobe y el piso de tierra, la casa esta ubicada en Viacha en la ciudad de La Paz.
Actualmente se dedica a la agricultura y también a la producción de leche y elaboración de queso trabajando por más de diez horas al día ya que debe cubrir los gastos de estudios y ayudar en los pagos de alimentación y servicios básicos de su familia, ya que con lo poco que gana no le alcanza para comprar una segadora es por eso que solicita el crédito.
El sueño de Betty, es entrar a estudiar en la universidad y de esa forma mejorar sus ingresos y poder independizase para mejorar su calidad de vida.
Es la segunda vez que solicita el crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera vez junto a KIVA.
texts.en:
Betty is single, and she does not have children.  She lives in her parents’ house, occupying a room with adobe walls and a dirt floor.  The house is located in Viacha in the city of La Paz.

She currently devotes herself to agriculture, milk production, and making cheese.  She works for over ten hours a day because she needs to cover the educational expenses and help pay for food and her family’s basic services.

With the little that she earns, she does not have enough to buy a reaper.  That is why she is requesting the loan.

Betty’s dream is to attend the university.  This way she would improve her income and be able to become independent in order to improve her quality of life.

This is the second time that she has requested a loan from IMPRO and the first time from Kiva.

loans.use: to buy a reaper to help improve her agricultural activities.

loans.name: Leona

texts.es:
Leona tiene 53 años, su esposo es Lauro, con quien tiene seis hijos. Su casa es propia, la compraron luego de muchos años de ahorro y sacrificio.

Ella se dedica a la venta de dulces, bebidas y comida en un quiosco que construyó al frente de una reconocida universidad de la ciudad. Hace 3 años comenzó a desarrollar el proyecto, pues quería ayudar a su esposo, quien es albañil y zapatero, en los gastos del hogar. Ahora, con la ayuda de una de sus hijas, en este negocio, pueden obtener un ingreso diario. Lo considera rentable, pues es la única que tiene un puesto en la universidad y por ende todos los alumnos consumen sus productos. “No tengo ninguna competencia”, afirma muy contenta. Pero como todo trabajo, tuvo inconveniente al desarrollar su negocio, como en las temporadas de vacaciones donde no hay alumnos y sus ventas decaen. Por ello desea surtir su negocio, con más productos, de esa manera, podrá captar otros clientes, como las personas que viven alrededor de la universidad.

Este es su segundo crédito con MFP y agradece el apoyo brindado, pues en todo ese tiempo logró incrementar sus ganancias, las que le sirvieron para adquirir mejoras en su negocio. Por esa razón promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. 
Leona invertirá el dinero de este préstamo en la compra de más dulces, bebidas y otros productos para surtir su quiosco de comestibles.
texts.en:
Leona is 53 years old and has six children with her husband, Lauro. They own their house, which they bought after many years of saving and sacrifice.

She works selling sweets, drinks, and food at a stall she set up across from a well-known university in the city. She started to develop the project three years ago, because she wanted to help her husband, who is a construction worker and a cobbler, with home expenses. Now, with one of their daughters' help, they can earn a daily income from her business. She considers it to be profitable, because she is the only one who has a stall at the university, so all the students consume her products. "I have no competition," she is very happy to say. But as with any job, she ran into problems as she developed her business, like during the holiday season, when there are no students and her sales decline. That is why she wants to stock her business with more products so that she can attract other customers, such as the people who live around the university.

This is her second loan with MFP and she is grateful for the support offered, because during all that time she was able to increase her profits, which allowed her to make improvements on her business. For this reason she promises to pay her installments on time.

Leona will invest the money from this loan in the purchase of more sweets, drinks, and other products, in order to stock her food stall.

loans.use: to purchase sweets, drinks, and other food items for her stall.

loans.name: Raquilda

texts.es:
Raquilda tiene 49 años, su esposo es Jorge, con quien tienen cinco hijos, de los cuales sólo vive con uno de ellos. Su casa es propia y está ubicada en la localidad de Daniel Hernández. 

Su principal actividad durante la semana es la compra y venta de ovejas. Su trabajo consiste en juntar ovejas de los ganaderos, las que después vende a mayor precio en las diferentes ferias ganaderas de su localidad. Viaja mucho, por eso es muy conocida en su zona. En esta temporada comienza la festividad en honor a los animales. “Ahí mis ganancias se incrementan, ya que no solo vendo ovejas, también cerdos, vacas, toros y burros. Tengo que aprovechar la fiesta, pues solo es una vez al año”, comenta. De la misma manera, y junto a su esposo se dedican a la venta de leña; compran árboles y ellos mismos cortan la leña para comercializarla en la ciudad, donde ya tienen clientes fijos. Paralelo a ese trabajo, su esposo realiza el oficio de albañil, arreglando diferentes casas y construyendo otras. Es de esta manera que esperan mejorar sus ingresos y para mantener la estabilidad familiar. 

Este es su octavo crédito con MFP, donde espera de un pequeño préstamo para que pueda cumplir con sus objetivos. Por otro lado, promete, una vez más, cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas. Además le agrada ser parte de su grupo porque todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y solidarias.
Raquilda invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de más animales para abastecer su negocio.
texts.en:
Raquilda, 49, is married to Jorge, with whom she has 5 children, only one of which lives at home. She owns her own house in the area Daniel Hernández.

Her principal activity during the week is to buy and sell sheep. She amasses sheep from farms and then goes off to sell them for the best offer at different animal fairs in her area. She’s well-known in her area because she travels quite a bit. The festival in honor of the animals is coming up at this time. “There my income increases, as I not only sell sheep, also pigs, cows, bulls and donkeys. I have to take advantage of the festival as it’s only once a year”, she comments. The same way, but with her husband, she sells firewood; they buy trees and chop wood themselves to sell it in the city where they have clients. Parallel to that job, her husband works in construction, renovating different houses and building others. Thisis the way they hope to generate more income and maintain family stability. 

This is her 8th loan with MFP, where she awaits another small loan so she can meet her objectives. She promises, once again, to meet her payments. Also, she enjoys being part of the group because all of the members are responsible and united people.

Raquilda will invest the loan in buying more animals to stock up her business.

loans.use: buy more animals to stock up her business.

loans.name: Tchargnate Group

texts.fr: Responsable du groupement TCHARGNATE, Mr Adjam est âgé de 34ans et est cultivateur. Il a 12enfants et 10 sont encore sur les bancs d’école. Sa conjointe est ménagère et il est dans ce domaine il y a un temps. Il cultive le sorgho et exerce l’activité en RÉGION CENTRALE. 07 personnes l’aident à faire développer son activité. Son souhait est d’avoir une grande superficie et construire un nouveau bâtiment pour la famille. Les autres membres sont dans les mêmes domaines et sont constitués de femmes et d’hommes qui ont une passion pour la terre. Ils veulent avoir ce fonds de WAGES pour acheter des outils de travail et voir leur famille s’épanouir.
texts.en:
Mr. Adjam, age 34, is the leader of the group TCHARGNATE. He has 12 children, ten of them still in school. His spouse is a homemaker. He has been a farmer for some time, and he works in the central region, growing sorghum. He has seven helpers to assist him with his work. His goal is to have a large farmable area and build a new house for his family. 

The other group members are men and women who share a passion for the land and work in similar activities. They are seeking this loan from WAGES to purchase farming tools. They want to ensure the future well-being of their families.

loans.use: to buy farming tools.

loans.name: Celidonia

texts.es:
Celidonia tiene 52 años. Enviudó hace 14 años, junto al que fue su esposo, tuvo seis hijos. Hoy sólo vive con uno de ellos, a quien cuida en su casa propia ubicada en la localidad de Hila.   

Desde que enviudó tuvo que tomar las riendas de la casa, agradece el apoyo de sus hijos, quienes le ayudaban en el noble oficio de la agricultura. En sus terrenos agrícolas siembra papa, olluco y habas dos veces al año, ya que posee terrenos agrícolas con regadío, es decir con disponibilidad de agua. Ella tiene que caminar muchas horas para poder llegar a sus sembríos, la caminata no le molesta, pues aprovecha en llevar a sus animales, tiene ovejas, burros, cerdos, gallinas y cuyes; los tres últimos los utiliza para consumo propio y los cría en su misma casa. Cuenta que en cada cosecha traslada sus productos a la ciudad, donde obtiene mayores ingresos. Ahora desea ahorrar todo el dinero que pueda, ya que piensa comprar una casa en la ciudad, donde quiere poner un negocio de venta de comida. 

Este es su quinto crédito con MFP y agradece el apoyo financiero que recibe, pues podrá concretar los objetivos de su negocio. Además promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas, ya que aprende mucho con los integrantes de su grupo.
Celidonia invertirá el dinero de este préstamo en la compra de fertilizantes naturales para esparcir entre sus sembríos de papa y olluco.
texts.en:
Celidonia is 52 years old and became a widow 14 years ago.  She and her husband had six children.  Now she lives with only one of them, whom she takes care of in her home located in Hila.

Since she became a widow she has had to take the reins in the home.  She appreciates her children’s support and their help with the noble work of farming.  She raises potatoes, yucca, and beans twice a year on her farmland.  She has farmlands with irrigation, meaning with access to water.  She must walk for many hours to get to where her crops are.  The walk doesn’t bother her but she takes advantage of this and takes her animals.  She has sheep, donkeys, pigs, chickens, and Guinea pigs.  She uses the last three kinds for personal consumption and she raises them in her home.  She takes each harvest to the city where she receives a greater income.  Now she would like to save all the money she can because she wants to buy a house where she can start a prepared food business.

This will be her fifth loan through MFP and she appreciates the financial support that she gets, as it will allow her to solidify her business objectives.  She also promises to be punctual with her payments and she says that she has learned a lot from the other members in the group.

Celidonia will invest the money from this loan to buy natural fertilizers to spread among her potato and yucca crops.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: María Del Socorro

texts.es:
La señora  María trabaja como profesora en una escuela de primaria publica desde hace 29 años, es casada y con un hijo a cargo.

Doña María es su segundo crédito con nuestra institución y pretende mejorar sus condiciones de vida por medio este crédito realizado compra de una cama.
texts.en: María has been working as an elementary school teacher for 29 years.  She’s married and has a son in her care.  This is María’s second loan with our institution and she intends to use this loan to improve her living conditions by buying a bed.

loans.use: to buy a bed.

loans.name: Tomas

texts.es:
El Sr.  Tomas a pesar de tener un problema en la columna eso no lo detiene a seguir adelante en la vida. Es padre de 4 hijos y siempre ve por el bienestar de ellos y de su futuro. Estando pendiente siempre de que no les falte nada de lo esencial, el sueño de Tomas es que sus hijos crezcan con una mente sana y muy bien educados. Junto con su esposa están preocupados ya que se acercan las fechas en las que  2 de sus hijos se gradúan y el está preocupado por no poder hacer que esa fecha sea especial para los dos y para él. 
Estará agradecido de poder ayudar a que su sueño se cumpla ya que la mayor parte la realizaron sus dos hijos de los cuales se encuentra orgulloso.
texts.en:
Tomas has a spinal problem, but that doesn't stop him from moving forward in life. He is a father of four and always has his children's welfare and their future in mind. Always making sure that they lack nothing essential, Tomas' dream is that his children grow up with a sane mind and a very good education. He and his wife are worried because two of their children will be graduating soon and he is worried that he won't be able to make it a special day for the two of them and himself.
He will be grateful for being able to help make his dream come true, since his two children have already done the most part. He is very proud of them.

loans.use: to pay for school fees.

loans.name: Venantie

texts.en:
Venantie is married with five children, four of whom attend schools. Her husband is also a maize farmer. She has been a maize farmer for 6 years. She would like to get this loan to pay for more seeds, seed multiplication (production of seeds for sale or for future planting), and support labor to get the best harvest. With the profits, she wants to make more savings.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay for more seeds, seed multiplication, and support labor costs.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia esta casada y tiene cuatro hijos que están en etapa escolar, viven en casa propia  ocupando cuatro habitaciones pequeñas con paredes de adobe y el piso de tierra, la misma se encuentra en la localidad de Viacha, en el –departamento de La Paz.
Ella estudió solo hasta la primaria y actualmente trabaja por más de diez horas en el área de la agricultura , producción de queso y leche para posteriormente venderlos ya que debe cubrir los gastos de educación y alimentación de su familia y con lo poco que gana no le alcanza para comprar una segadora.
El crédito lo solicita para la compra de una segadora  que le facilitará la cosecha de alfalfa, alimento para las vacas, quienes producen la leche que usa para la producción de quesos. Actualmente Julia usa una hoz para la cosecha, pero es muy cansador pues tiene que estar agachada todo el tiempo; con la segadora será mucho más fácil.
El sueño de Julia, es mejorar sus ingresos para poder pagar los estudios de universidad de sus hijos.
Es la primera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y KIVA.
texts.en:
Julia is married and has four children who are school age; they live in a house of their own occupying four small rooms with adobe walls and dirt floors located in Viacha in La Paz Department.  She only went to elementary school and currently works more than ten hours in farming producing cheese and milk that she subsequently sells to cover family food and education costs.  With the little she earns she does not have enough to buy a harvester.

She’s asking for the loan to buy a harvester that will make harvesting alfalfa which is the feed for her cows that produce the milk to make the cheese easier.  Currently Julia uses a sickle to harvest but it is exhausting because she has to bend down all the time; the harvester will make things much easier.

Julia’s dream is to improve her income so that she can pay for her children’s university education.  This is the first time she’s requested credit from IMPRO and KIVA.

loans.use: to buy a harvester.

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
Norma tiene 32 años, está casada con Marcelino, con quien tiene dos hijos; Eliana y Lindsey. La casa donde viven es propia y está ubicada en el anexo de Chalampampa.   
Vivir en el campo, cuidar de sus sembríos y obtener buenos productos, es su principal actividad económica. Desde muy niña le enseñaron a cuidar de la tierra y vivir de ella, por ello cuando conformó su familia no tuvo reparos en hacer de ella su principal sustento económico; pues también se dedica al cuidado de niños en su casa. Sus terrenos agrícolas se ubican en la localidad de Pusqui, donde obtuvo hectáreas de terrenos agrícolas. Cuenta que fue muy difícil comenzar a sembrar pues, tenía que alquilar terrenos agrícolas para realizar el trabajo y por ende no adquiría buenas ganancias. “Ahora que tengo mis propios terrenos y obtengo más ingresos. En cada cosecha vendo mis productos a la ciudad, donde tengo clientes conocidos que adquieren mis productos en las campañas agrícolas”, afirma.

Este es su crédito número 5 con MFP y agradece el apoyo brindado, pues en todo este tiempo logró incrementar sus ganancias. Por esa razón promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas.
Norma invertirá este dinero en la compra de fertilizantes naturales para esparcir en sus próximos sembríos de papa.
texts.en:
Norma, 32, is married to Marcelino with whom she has 2 children, Eliana and Lindsey. She owns their house and it’s situated in the area of Chalampampa.

Her main economic activity is to work the land, take care of her crops and obtain a good product.
Ever since she was a little girl, she was taught how to take care of the land and live from it and so when she got formed her own family, it became her principal economic support; she also takes care of children in her home.

Her plots of land are in Pusqui, where she got hectars of agricultural land. She says it was tough to start planting because she had to rent plots of land and she didn’t make very good money. “Now that I have my own plots of land, I generate more income. With each harvest, I sell my products in the city where I have well-known clients who buy my products in the agricultural fairs”, she affirms.

This is her 5th loan with MFP and she is gratefull for the support she has been given, as in all of this tinme she has been able to increase her income. 
For that reason, she promises to be punctual with her payments. 

Norma will invest her loan into buying natural fertilizers to spread onto her next potato crop.

loans.use: buy natural fertilizers.

loans.name: Maria Socorro

texts.es:
Maria tiene 31 años de edad, conviviente y con 06 hijos a su cargo. Vive en casa propia con su conviviente y sus hijos. La casa está ubicada en el Distrito de Tambogrande al norte del Peru. Cliente vive en la parte  rural del distrito y cuenta con servicio de luz. El programa de 'Capital Semilla' que Edpyme desarrolla con Kiva se enfoca en promover el accesso a credito a clientes que normalmente tienen mayor dificultad en obtenerlos. Maria es una de las benefeciarias de este programa.

La actividad que desarrolla la titular es la ganadería (ovino, porcino y aves de corral), los cuales al alcanzar peso y tamaño ideal los comercializa en el mercado local. También cuenta con 1.0 ha de terreno agrícola en donde cosecha limón semanalmente. Tiene una experiencia de más de 5 años en la ganadería y agricultura. Su conviviente es trabajador estable en un fundo agrícola del caserío. Teniendo en cuenta las necesidades del negocio Maria a solicitado un prestamo de 1000 soles para la fertilización del cultivo de limón.
texts.en:
Maria is 31, in a common-law relationship, and has six children in her care. She lives in her own house with her partner and her children. The house is located in Tambogrande district in northern Peru.

The borrower lives in the rural part of the district and has electricity service. The "'Capital Semilla" (Seed Capital) program that Edpyme is carrying out with Kiva is focused on promoting access to credit for clients who normally have greater difficulty in obtaining it. Maria is one of the beneficiaries of this program.

The activity that the borrower carries out is livestock-raising: sheep, pigs and poultry, which she sells in the local market when they reach ideal size and weight. She also has one hectare of farmland where she harvests lemons weekly. 

She has more than five years experience in livestock-raising and farming. Her partner has steady job on a farm in the settlement. Taking into account the needs of her business, María has applied for a loan of 1,000 soles for fertilizing her lemon plantation.

loans.use: To carry out the much-needed fertilizing of her lemon plantation.

loans.name: Nestor Abel

texts.es: Cliente de 22 años de  edad, conviviente y con 01 hijo a su cargo. Vive en casa propia, la cual está ubicada en el distrito de Tambogrande al norte del Peru. El y su familia vive en la parte rural  de este distrito y cuenta con servicio básico de luz eléctrica. A pesar de su corta edad, ha demonstrado ser una persona trabajadora y con ganas de salir adelante. Y por esta razon esta buscando un credito que lo ayude con sus ambicion de consolidar su negocio. La actividad que desarrolla es la crianza de ganado ovino, porcino y aves de corral, los cuales cría y engorda para luego comercializarlos en mercado local. Cuenta con corrales apropiados para la crianza. También se desempeña como obrero en fabrica, la actividad de crianza la desarrolla hace 06 años aproximadamente. Además se dedica a labores de peón agrícola en parcelas aledañas. Reflejando la cultura peruana con una orientacion muy importante en al familia, el cuenta el apoyo de su conviviente y el de sus padres quienes lo apoyan en sus proposito. Por lo tanto ha recurrido ala inciativa de Epyme y Kiva para adquir un crédito que lo ayude con la adquisición de más ganado y compra de alimentos balanceados para sus animales.
texts.en:
He’s 22-years-old, has a spouse and a son in his care.  He lives in his own house that’s located in Tambogrande District in northern Perú.  He and his family live in the rural part of this district and only have electricity.  Despite his young age he’s shown himself to be a hardworking person who very much wants to get ahead.  Because of this he’s looking for a loan to help him with his desire to consolidate his business.

The activity he carries out is raising livestock: sheep, pigs and barnyard fowl that he raises and fattens up to then sell in the local market.  He has corrals that are apt for their care.  He also works as a laborer in a factory.  He’s been raising livestock for about 6 years.  He also works as a day laborer in nearby fields.

Reflecting Peruvian culture which stresses the importance of the family, he gets support from his spouse and from his parents who support his efforts.  
He has, therefore, called on Edpyme Alternativa and Kiva to request a loan that will help him acquire more livestock and to buy nutritionally balanced feed for his animals.

loans.use: to buy more livestock and animal feed.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 58 years old. For the past year she has sold lumber for a living.

Esther is applying for a 800,000 RWF loan from UOB to buy more lumber to sell. Her profits will be used to reinvest in the business.

loans.use: to buy more lumber to sell.

loans.name: Assoumani

texts.en: Assoumani is 32 years old and single. He sells clothes and has been in this business for 10 years. The loan requested will be used to buy more clothes to sell. With the profits from the business, Assoumani will build a house.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a forty-year-old married woman with five children between the ages of 13 and 27 years. They live in Tiribe, Kenya.

Fatuma has been running a grounding (milling) machine for 7 years. Her hardships are high taxes, customers not paying on time, price fluctuation, and seasonality.

Her personal goals are educating her children and building a permanent house for residence. Her business goals are expanding her business and possibly open new businesses.

Fatuma wants the loan to service her grounding machine.

loans.use: to service her grounding machine.

loans.name: Nilda

texts.es:
NILDA TIENE 40 ANOS Y VIVE EM EÑ NORTE DEL PERU. COMO ES TRADICION EN PERU, ELLA ESTA ACARGO DE SUS PADRES Y VIVE CON ELLOS. ES CONOCIDA EN EL MEDIO POR SU LABOR EN LA VENTA DE ABARROTES EN SU LOCALIDAD Y SU GRAN ESFUERZO. SUS  PADRES TAMBIEM LA  APOYAN  EN LAS LABORES DEL NEGOCIO. NILDA SE DEDICA A LA  VENTA DE ABAROTES , DESDE  HACE MÁS DE  02 AÑOS Y QUIEN CONSOLIDAR SU NEGOCIO DADO EL POTENTIAL PARA ATENDER A LA DEMANDA INSATISFECHA DEL LUGAR. POR LO TANTO HA PEDIDO UN PRÉSTAMO DE 1000 SOLES QUE INVERTIRÁ EN SU NEGOCIO Y ARREGLOS DE SU CASA. EN PARTICULAR QUIERE INCREMENTAR EL STOCK THE MERCANCIA Y AMPLIAR LOS PRODUCTOS OFRECIDOS.

LOGRARÁ ATENDER LA DEMANDA INSATISFECHA EN EL LUGAR,  AMPLIARÁ SU CARTERA DE CLIENTES,CONTANDO CON CLIENTES NUEVOS E INGRESOS ADICIONALES A LA FAMILIA.
texts.en:
Nilda, 40, lives in north Perú.  Following Peruvian tradition, she cares for her parents and lives with them.  She’s known in her surroundings for selling groceries and for her great efforts.  Her parents also help her with the business’ work.

Nilda has been selling groceries for more than two years and wants to consolidate the business in order to have the potential of increasing the number of her customers and to meet unmet local demand which is why she’s taken out a 1000 sol loan to invest in her business and to do some home improvements.  In particular, she wants to increase stock merchandise and expand the variety of products she offers.  She will manage to meet unmet local demand, expand her clientele with new customers and provide additional family income.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Martha Florita

texts.es:
Martha es una mujer de 20 años, vive en la ciudad de Nazca con sus padres y hermanos, ella siempre ha sido una joven muy alegre, trabajadora y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; gracias al apoyo de sus padres, quienes siempre han estado a su lado pudo cursar sus estudios técnicos de Gastronomía; en sus ratos libres le gusta ver programas educativos en televisión y en algunas ocasiones le gusta cocinar comida china para compartir con su familia.
Con mucho empeño, entusiasmo y gracias al apoyo de sus padres, Martha puso en marcha su pequeño negocio de venta de abarrotes, ella realiza las ventas en su hogar y dedica a su negocio un aproximado de 10 horas diarias, ella se siente a gusto realizando su labor ya que gracias a su trabajo puede solventar sus gastos y apoyar a sus padres, Martha cree que su negocio marcha bien debido a los buenos precios y al trato amable que brinda a los demás. 
Martha se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de mercadería para su negocio, tales como: arroz, azúcar, menestras, leche, aceite, bebidas, cerveza, entre otros; de esta manera Martha podrá tener su negocio mejor abastecido y así incrementara sus ventas e ingresos económicos, con los cuales espera poder ampliar su negocio vendiendo desayunos y así en un futuro no muy lejano desea poder cumplir su gran sueño de tener su propio restaurante.
texts.en:
Martha is twenty years old and lives in the city of Nazca with her parents and siblings. She has always been a very cheerful girl, hard-working and enthusiastic, and has a strong desire to better herself. Thanks to her parents' support, who have always been by her side, she was able to go to culinary school. In her free time, she enjoys watching educational programs on television and sometimes she likes to prepare Chinese food to share with her family.
With a lot of perseverance, enthusiasm, and thanks to her parents' support, Martha started her small business. She sells groceries at home and dedicates about ten hours of work a day to her business. She is confortable with her work because it allows her to cover her expenses and help her parents. Martha believes her business is going well because her prices are good and she treats others kindly.
Martha is very grateful to Kiva lenders because, thanks to the help they offer, she will be able to purchase merchandise for her business, such as rice, sugar, legumes, milk, oil, drinks, beer, and other items. This will allow Martha to have a better-stocked business and, in turn, increase her sales and her income, which she hopes to use to expand her business by selling breakfasts so that, in the near future, she can make her greatest dream come true, which is to open her own restaurant.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise, such as rice, sugar, legumes, milk, oil, drinks, etc.

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en:
Jacqueline is 36 years old and has four children. For the past six years she has run her own restaurant.

Jacqueline is applying for a 300,000 RWF loan from UOB to buy more food and drink to sell in her establishment. Her profits will be applied toward buying a new place for her restaurant.

loans.use: to buy more food and drink to sell in her restaurant.

loans.name: Jose Esgard

texts.es:
José de 22 años, es  un joven emprededor, que viveubicada en el distrito de Tambogrande en el norte del Peru. El y sus padres viven en esta zona que se caracterizan por la actividad agrícola, ganadera y artesana. Este es el segundo prestamo que Jose obtiene con el apoyo de Kiva, mostrando gran responsabilidad con el cumplimento del pago del prestamo anterior. Dado el gran exito de su credito anterior el busca un nuevo prestamo de 2000 soles para invertirlo en alimento balanceaod para su ganado y asi consolidar su negocio.

José se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales de corral como ovejas y cerdos, desde hace un año, cuenta con sus corrales amplios para sus animales, los alimenta con comida balanceada y pastos  naturales para engordarlos y pueda venderlos a sus clientes a un buen precio, obteniendo ingresos para solventar sus obligaciones personales. Complementariamente se dedica a la compra-venta de tamarindo y leña, la cual comercializa en diferentes sectores del valle. Cuenta con 3 años de experiencia en el negocio. Su madre aval del presente crédito tiene parcela en donde ha instalado mango, maracuyá, cacao y limón.
texts.en:
José, 22, is a young entrepreneur living in Tambogrande District in northern Perú.  He and his parents live in this zone which is noted for agriculture, animal husbandry and crafts.  This is the second loan José gets with support from Kiva having shown great responsibility with the payment of his previous loan.  Given the great success with his previous loan he’s looking for a new 2000 sol loan to buy nutritionally balanced feed for his livestock thus consolidating his business.

José has been raising and selling farm animals like sheep and pigs for a year.  He has spacious corrals for his animals and he feeds them nutritionally balanced feed and natural grasses to fatten them up and then sell them to his customers at a good price earning income to cover his personal expenses.  In addition, he’s also a tamarind and firewood merchant.  He sells them in various parts of the valley.  He has three years’ experience in his business.  His mother is backing this loan; she has a parcel of land where she grows mangoes, passion fruit, cocoa beans and lemons.

loans.use: To purchase balanced food and invest in the health of his livestock.

loans.name: Dilcia

texts.es: Dilcia tiene 45 años de edad, es conviviente con 1 hijo dependiente. Vive en casa propia,en el Distrito de Tambogrande al norte del Peru. Cuenta con servicios básicos de luz y agua y vive en la parte urbana de la zona. Ella ha demonstrado ser muy emprendedor cuando vio la oportunidad de establecer una tienda de comida que ayudaria a satisfacer la demanda de la comunidad. La actividad que desarrolla la titular es la venta de abarrotes, bebidas y golosinas, hace aproximadamente más de 4 años. Atendiendo todos los días en su propio domicilio, para lo cual cuenta con clientela establecida. Solicita crédito para la compra de mercadería en artículos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, aceites, etc. Compra de bebidas, golosinas. Esto le ayudara tener mercaderia en stock y ofrecer al publico una amplia variedad de opciones. Clienta conocida en la zona y deseos de expansión.
texts.en:
Dilicia, 45, has a spouse and one dependent son.  She lives in her own house in Tambogrande District in northern Perú.  It has electricity and water and she lives in the urban part of the zone.  She showed herself to be very enterprising when she saw the opportunity of opening a grocery store that would help her meet local demand.

The activity she carries out is selling groceries, soft-drinks and snacks.  She’s been in business for more than four years.  She’s open every day and works from home; she has an established regular clientele.

She’s asking for the loan to buy merchandise to stock her store.  She will buy basic staple goods like rice, sugar, oil, soft-drinks, snacks, etc.  This will help her have merchandise in stock and to offer the public a wider variety of options.  She is well known in the zone and wants to expand.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Alphonsine

texts.en:
Alphonsine is 43 years old. She is married to a businessman, and they have four children.

Alphonsine sells sweet potatoes and cassava in her eatery. She is applying for a 400,000 RWF loan from UOB to buy more cassava as well as sweet potatoes to serve. She plans to use the profits for renovating her house.

loans.use: to buy more cassava as well as sweet potatoes to serve.

loans.name: Jose David

texts.es: José David, de 25 años de edad, este joven emprendedor inicio su negocio desde hace 6 años, como es juego videos para niños y adultos colocado en su casa de habitación en el barrio de Guadalupe león. El financiamiento lo quiere para la compra de material de trabajo nuevo: como juegos nuevos, DVD, sillas, televisores entre otros.
texts.en: José David is 25 years old. This young entrepreneur started his business six years ago. It offers videogames for children and adults and is located in his residence, which is in the neighborhood of Guadalupe, in León. The reason he wants financing is to purchase new material for his work, such as new games, DVDs, chairs, TVs, and other items.

loans.use: to purchase new games, DVDs, chairs, TVs, and other items.

loans.name: Marie Claire

texts.en:
Marie Claire is 26 years old. She has one child. For the past two years she has run her own beauty salon.

Marie Claire is applying for a 500,000 RWF loan from UOB to buy more equipment for her salon. She will save her profits for future use.

loans.use: to buy more equipment for her salon.

loans.name: Flor Maria

texts.es:
Flor ha tenido que atravesar por muchas adversidades en su vida, sin embargo siempre ha tenido la fortaleza para salir adelante y continuar progresando junto con sus hijos. Desde hace 25 años salió de su municipio natal desplazada por la violencia y fue así como llegó a la ciudad en busca de mejores oportunidades económicas. Actualmente, madre soltera cabeza de hogar de 6 hijos, Flor se enfrenta a la gran dificultad de ser la única en su hogar con posibilidades de generar ingresos para sostener su familia, por esto trabaja fuertemente en su negocio el cual es una venta de accesorios y artesanías en madera. En el sector ya lleva ubicada bastante tiempo y gracias a la buena calidad de sus productos es muy reconocida, y debido a que en la actualidad tiene una gran cantidad de pedidos por parte de sus clientes, Flor busca un préstamo para comprar artículos y artesanías en madera para responder a los pedidos que le han hecho sus clientes.

De esta manera superará la dificultad de capital que tiene en su negocio y así le permitirá tener mejores ingresos para su familia al satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes. Además, podrá seguir brindando en su hogar mejores oportunidades económicas para progresar y una mejor calidad de vida a sus 6 hijos.
texts.en:
Flor has had to go through many adversities in her life.  However, she’s always had the strength to continue forward and making progress with her children.  

Because of the violence she left the town of her birth 25 years ago arriving in the city in search of better economic opportunities.  She’s currently a single mother head of household with six children.  

Flor faces the great difficulty of being the only one in her home who is an income-earner to support the family which is why she works hard in her business selling accessories and wood crafts.  She’s been in the sector for quite some time and thanks to the good quality of her products she’s very well-known.  

Because she currently has a large number of pending customer orders, Flor is looking for a loan to buy items and wood crafts to fill customer orders.  In this way she will overcome the problem of capital her business has and will be able to earn better income for her family by meeting customer demand.  In addition, she will be able to continue providing better economic opportunities for progress for her home and a better quality of life for her six children.

loans.use: to buy wood crafts.

loans.name: Maria Virginia

texts.es: Maria virginia, soltera de 55 años de edad, con cinco hijos mayores tiene por actividad economica una panaderia ubicada en su casa de habitacion actividad que la inicio desde hace 6 años en la actualidad le ha ido muy bien gracias a su esfuerzo su dedicacion y la ayuda que fundacion leon 2000 le ha brindado para sacar adelante su negocio, el fiannciamiento lo quiere para la compra de materia prima como: arina, queso, mantequilla, cazulejas, leña, aceite.
texts.en: Maria Virginia is 55 years old and single. She has five adult children and her business is a bakery located in her residence. She started this business six years ago and currently it is going very well, thanks to her effort and dedication and to the help offered by Fundacion Leon 2000 in order to get her business going. The reason she wants financing is to purchase raw materials such as flour, cheese, butter, baking tins, firewood, and oil.

loans.use: to purchase flour, cheese, butter, baking tins, firewood, and oil.

loans.name: Mariamu

texts.en:
Mariamu is married and has six school-age children. Her family has their own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

She only attended elementary school. She currently earns income from the sale of charcoal. She is requesting the loan to buy sacks of charcoal for sale. It is the only income she has to cover her family’s expenses for food, education, and basic services.

She works 12 hours a day, and the little amount that she earns is not enough to increase her merchandise. Her husband works as a carpenter. He also supports the family. 
Mariamu’s dream is to expand her business and have a charcoal depot in the future. She wishes to be able to cover her children’s school expenses.

This is the first time she has requested a loan from Yehu and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal.

loans.name: Mesaidi

texts.en:
Mesaidi is a 36-year-old married woman and mother of five children. Three years ago, she opened a tailoring shop to contribute to her household’s expenses. She says that this is the only business she depends on. Throughout the years, she has succeeded in building a sound reputation among tailors in her town.

Mesaidi is applying for a loan to buy clothing materials and sewing threads. As demand for her services increases, Mesaidi needs to maintain the good quality she has been offering. With the money left from the loan, she will invest in farming to earn money to cater toward the little expenses.

loans.use: to buy clothing materials and sewing threads.

loans.name: Fe Y Amor 3 Group

texts.en:
Dominga is the coordinator of her group, Fe y Amor (Faith and Love) 3. Her group is located in Santiago, an area famous for tobacco and beef production, the second biggest city in the Dominican Republic. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and their three children. She says that her most difficult challenge is raising her children. She enjoys cooking and spending time with her family.

Dominga is excited to be taking her sixth loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She has had her business for three years, started with her first loan. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying clothes, underwear, cosmetics and shoes. She will save the profits and also use the money to pay for her family's expenses. She dreams of having her own house and improving her business.

loans.use: To buy various products (cosmetics, clothes, shoes, etc.).

loans.name: Fatim

texts.en: Fatim is 22 years old and lives in the Jacob Town area. She is single, and stopped her education in the ninth grade. For the past six years she has been involved in the sale of charcoal and other goods. Her main challenge is price increases. She started this business with money from her friends. She will use the loan to purchase more charcoal for her business. She will use the profits to pay her house rent and one day would like to own her own house.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is 34 years old and works in her sales business in order to support her household. She sells foodstuffs in the open air. She tells us that this is her only business that generates income for her. When her husband gave her some start-up capital, she was able to make use of her personal values to start up and manage a sales business.

Fatuma is the mother of four children who are all in school. She dreams of helping her children become successful people and so she takes care to educate them and work hard so that she can teach them the same values that her parents taught her. 
Fatuma started her business over five years ago and she has gradually attracted a number of regular customers who, in turn, refer her to new customers. For this reason, the working capital she has with which to buy goods and respond to demand has become insufficient. For this reason, she is applying for a loan to buy wheat flour and cooking oil.

loans.use: to buy wheat flour and cooking oil.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is married and has 5 children. She is 53 years old and resides in Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Evelyn cultivates bananas and cassava for to earn a living and she's been in this business for 10 years.

Each month, Evelyn earns 15,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) doing this type of business. She requested a loan of 23,800 PHP to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise. In 2009, Evelyn joined GDMPC. In the future, Evelyn wants to make improvements to her house and to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise.

loans.name: Eveline

texts.en:
Eveline is married with six children aged between 8 and 19. All of them go to school. She has grown Irish potatoes for seven years. She would like this loan to buy fertilizer and seeds, and pay for the labor to get the best harvest. With the profits, she plans to expand the area she has been farming.
The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds, and pay for labor costs.

loans.name: Abbas

texts.en: Abbas is a Lebanese single man. He’s 31 years old. He’s really attached to his parents and sibling. Cooperating together, Abbas and his family were able to cover their heavy living expenses in order to live a respectable life. Abbas started his business at an early age. He had to work with great professionalism to prove that he’s a necessary support for his family. Abbas started his own work in 1998. He has been working as a car mechanic in his own garage and has gained a fair number of customers asking for his services. Today, he’s asking for a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to buy more mechanic tools for his business in order to respond rapidly to his clients’ problems. He believes that acting properly is really essential to attract more and added customers. In the future, he plans to open his own car showroom.

loans.use: to buy more mechanic tools for his business.

loans.name: Sarhan

texts.en: Sarhan is a 52-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and four children (three of them are still attending school). He has owned a car repair shop since 1992. His job consists of repairing the bodies of vehicles. Serhan owns a small apartment and, in order to get additional income, he decided in 2005 to rent it out up till now. Today, he is asking to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase a car and perform the needed smithy work on it (repainting it and repairing the damaged components) in order to resell it in good condition and make a fair profit. In the future, he is planning to open a bigger store to buy and sell spare car parts.

loans.use: to purchase a car and perform the needed smithy work on it.

loans.name: Fouad

texts.en: Fouad is a 50-year-old Lebanese married man. He lives with his wife and two children. He really loves his family and strives to work really hard to be able to offer them a fair way of life far from life's complications and problems, especially after being the only one responsible for them. Fouad started his business in 1982. He has owned a discotheque and has his own loyal customers always asking for his items since he has a huge variety of items. Fouad believes that acting properly will help him attract added clients and stay in good relation with them. Today, he needs to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase CD's and DVD's for his business. He confirms that this step will increase his sales and revenues, and thus better his way of life. Sarhan is very ambitious and looks forward to earning higher income to better support his family.

loans.use: to purchase CD's and DVD's for his business.

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
Salome is married with six children. She has been a maize farmer for 10 years. Her husband is also a maize farmer. She would like to get this loan to buy more seeds, support seed multiplication, and pay labor costs to get the best harvest. With the profits, she wants to buy more plots of land for maize growing.
The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under-served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more seeds and support labor costs.

loans.name: Cyprien

texts.en:
Cyprien is married with six children. His wife works as a farmer. He has grown Irish potatoes for 10 years. He would like to get this loan to buy fertilizer and seeds, and pay for the labor needed to get the best harvest. With the profits, Cyprien plans to farm a larger area, and build a commercial building in the trading center.
The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers and seeds, and pay for labor costs.

loans.name: Adrien

texts.en:
Adrien is married with three children aged between four and twelve. His wife works as a farmer. He has grown Irish potatoes for 12 years. Adrien would like this loan to buy fertilizers and seeds, and pay for the labor needed to get the best harvest. With the profits, he plans to expand his farming area and buy a cow to provide milk for the family.
The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers and seeds, and pay for labor costs.

loans.name: Edison

texts.en:
Edison is married with four children. Three of them attend school. His wife works as a farmer. Edison has farmed Irish potatoes for 20 years. He would like this loan to buy fertilizer and seeds, and pay for the labor needed to get the best harvest. With the profits, he plans to expand his farming area and pay school fees.
The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers and seeds, and pay for labor costs.

loans.name: Caminando Hacia El Progreso 1 & 7 Group

texts.en:
Maria is one of the members of the group Caminando Hacia el Progreso (Walking to the Future) 1 & 7. This group is located in a rural community surrounded by sugarcane fields in the outskirts of San Pedro de Macoris. Maria will be sharing in a 174,500 DOP loan the group is applying for from Esperanza.

Maria makes her home in a simple structure with her long-term partner and a child. For the past four years she has operated a beauty salon where she serves her clients and sells different products. She started her salon with her own capital after saving for a while.

Maria is excited to be a part of this third loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan portions and grown her business. She plans to use her loan to invest in her salon by buying hair and beauty products, cosmetics and other beauty supplies.

Maria says that her most difficult challenges are improving her business and helping her family. Nevertheless, she plans to continue enjoying working in her salon.

loans.use: to buy hair and beauty products, cosmetics and other beauty supplies.

loans.name: Salley

texts.en: Salley is 46 years old and lives in Jacob Town. She is married and has four children between 10 to 24 years old. All of them are in school and live at home. For the past fifteen years she has been selling used clothes in the local market. She is requesting a loan to purchase more used clothes for her business. Salley hopes to send her children to quality schools and build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothes for her business.

loans.name: Gonzalo

texts.es:
Gonzalo estudió hasta la secundaria y actualmente percibe ingresos de su trabajo como chofer por más de doce horas al día y hasta altas horas de la noche ya que debe cubrir los gastos de educación, alimentación y pago de servicios básicos de su familia.
Es por eso que solicita el crédito para el mantenimiento anual de su vehiculo (chequeo de liquidos, frenos, llantas) ya que es el único que solventa los gastos de su familia y su vehiculo es su herramienta de trabajo.
El es casado y tiene dos hijos que están en etapa escolar , viven en casa de sus padres ocupando tres habitaciones , la casa esta ubicada en la zona bajo Llojeta de la ciudad de La Paz.
Es la segunda vez que trabaja junto a IMPRO y la primera vez junto a KIVA.
texts.en:
Gonzalo studied up to secondary school and currently earns income working as a driver more than twelve hours daily well into the night because he must cover his family’s basic education, food and utility costs.

This is why he’s asking for a loan to provide his vehicle’s annual service (fluids check, brakes, tires) since he’s the only one who covers his family’s expenses and his vehicle is his work tool.

He’s married and has two children who are school age.  They live in his parents’ house occupying three rooms.  The house is located in the city of La Paz’s Bajo Llojeta zone.

This is the second time he’s worked with Impro and the first with Kiva.

loans.use: to service his taxi.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is married with two children aged two and a half and fourteen. The oldest attends school.

For the past four years Emmanuel and his wife have farmed maize. He is applying for a 892,500 RWF loan from UOB to buy more seed and pay for labor on his farm in order to realize the best harvest he can. With his profits he plans to pay school fees and renovate the family’s house.

As of 2009 the agriculture sector has accounted for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans.
